intro: Pseudognaphalium sandwicensium var. hawaiiense, commonly known as the Hawaiian everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow to white, which bloom throughout the year. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of the island's interior. This variety is considered rare and is often found in specific microhabitats on the islands of Maui and Hawaii.
